inn1.comm: good pace, and a good leave on the off stump - bending back into him. Good start all round
two deliveries in, and Matt Prior concedes his first byes of the innings. A bit unlucky, to be fair. Steepling bounce from a short ball, and no way to cut that off
down the leg side - not a wide, though. A touch fortuitously methinketh
left alone outside off
pace, bounce and a flaying shot by Strauss trying to uppercut it over the slips but he misses
pushed out on the front foot but he can't bissect the field. A good maiden
outside off and a touch of movement away from Bopara's fishy little defensive
actual and literal runs, as those from West London say, as Bopara comes forward and it takes a thick outside edge past the slips
a touch of swing away from the right hander who leaves alone
punched off the back foot to point
wide of the off stump and left alone
well wide and left alone. In fact, that's called a wide - rightly so
excellent line and length and Bopara is forced into a defensive on the back foot
on his legs, nudged to leg
a quick, sharp bouncer - that was slick! But it's flying over the batsman and the keeper
ouch! Bopara has completely misread that, ducking into a good-length delivery and it smashes into his shoulder. He's worn one there.
fuller length here - Edwards really has his tail up
shuffles back and across, defending it with a straight bat
a very firm and impressively orthodox forward defence
left alone outside off. Too wide, that
crisply clipped to point
nicely driven but straight to mid-off. Timed that well
punched off the back foot this time, again to mid-off
more nice timing from Strauss but this time his leg-side clip picks out midwicket
punched to cover - and another maiden for West Indies. Excellent start by them. Good, disciplined lines and their fielders are alive
defended on the front foot
a calm nudged through midwicket - really sweetly played, flicking his wrists and picking up three
Strauss is back in line and defending out to the off side
the wrong line from Edwards. On Strauss's pads, it's whipped down to fine leg
Bopara stands tall and guides it out to cover

excellent line and Strauss defends it confidently. I know that sounds like a contradiction in terms, but it is actually possible. A crisp, backward defence where the ball shoots off the bat but straight to the fielder
wide of the off stump - he's lucky to get away with that
hops back, pushes it off the back foot
reasonable line outside off, and there's prodigious bounce for Baker here too. Bopara ignores it
sways out of the way of a quick ball at 87.8mph
punched to cover
short of a length and he tries to work it out to the off side but gets a thick inside edge
whipped off his hip down to fine leg
got him! That's a superb take from Gayle. Strauss went for a hook but it was too quick and he skied it over the slips. But Gayle, running back 10 or 11 paces, took a fine catch over his head
Bopara's timed that beautifully but straight back into the bowler's boot, where it ricochets out to cover
that is awful from Bopara. Excellent bowling, mind - nice, quick and aggressive and Bopara tried to hook it but it got big on him. The ball made its limp, feeble way straight to mid-on
back in his crease, nudged to leg
that is quick! I'm here to tell you - seriously sharp. Wide enough for Shah to leave it alone, but an 89mph bouncer is never much fun
guided out to the off side
good line and length and it's defended
Pietersen shuffles across and, with his head right over the ball, defends
again skips to leg and tries to flick it through midwicket, but can't
dropped to leg
short of a length, Pietersen goes for a pull but is beaten for pace
timed off the back foot to short cover
comes forward and forces it, with plenty of urgent bottom hand, but straight to mid-off
a slingly, flattish delivery outside off and Shah follows it exposing all three of his stumps. Dangerous tactic

blocked off the back foot and Shah's pantomime running is on display for the first time today. He shuffled down the pitch, opened both arms to Pietersen in a call for a hug, or a run, but neither was forthcoming. Another desperate shuffle and plea for a run before he skips back into his crease
yowzers! Tennis-ball bounce and it flies over the batsman and the wicketkeeper for four! This is a slippery pitch my friends
on the back foot and defending. He asks Pietersen if he'd like to run. Pietersen is not in a hurry, and who can blame him?
forward onthe front foot, guides it out to the off side
left alone outside off
flicked to leg
what a shot. Steps to leg and flicks it with those elasticated wrists over midwicket
attempts a hook but can't get hold of it
again steps outside off before turning it down to fine leg
wide of the off stump and left alone
wallop. A length ball, outside off, fetched with a flourish over long-on. Extravagent
walking across his stumps once again, a wristy flourish and a flick to fine leg. A lot of effort for not a lot
stand and deliver stuff, except Pietersen can't time his flog into the off side
a hop and a clip, worked off the hip to fine leg
short, outside off this time. Shah flinches but that's safely avoided
a dab into the gully with an angled bat, a quick single, and England continue to regroup
a firm drive into the covers, but can't find the gap
whipped to midwicket, but straight to the fielder
forward and driven back to the bowler
on the back foot, Pietersen has to pedal as Simmons swoops at mid-on, but his flicked shy goes wide
short, sits up, and flat-batted over midwicket. Top shot
fuller, straighter, defended
short, Pietersen climbs into the hook with two men back. Pollard is under a swirling skier, takes it with aplomb, and now England are in deep, deep doo-doo
the onus is really on Shah now
driven firmly into the covers, but can't beat the field
down the leg-side, but Bucknor doesn't call wide as Shah walked so far across his stumps
short, and swiped into the leg-side again
good length delivery, attacking the top of off. Defended. Tidy over
outside off, and nurdled to gully
tapped to cover
short, wide, slapped ... straight to backward point! A nothing sort of shot from Shah and he's paid the price, as Darren Sammy swoops low with his big hands.
diligently ignored outside off stump
another aggressively determined leave
outside off, pushed to point. And runs are simply superfluous right now
flicked onto a good length, Bravo's wrist does all sorts of interesting tricks in the delivery
full length once again, straight as a straight thing
on the pads, and worked to fine leg
forward and agonisingly defended, all perpendicular elbows and angles
hopping back and across, and defended again
short, leg-sided, Flintoff has a swish, and whaddaya know, he's lofted it straight to Fidel Edwards at fine leg!
full and straight, and patted back down the pitch
forward and defended back down the pitch
a tiny bit of width, but not enough to tempt him out of his shell
that's runs, a cool punch from an over-pitched delivery. Mid-on can't intercept
poked into the covers
short and wide, and patted to gully
a marginal error in line, too full and leg-sided, and helped round the corner
width outside off stump, and left alone with a flourish
short, and belated evasive action from Prior. There's a bit of life in this track
on the pads, clipped to backward square
forward, and prodded to point
full and straight, and defended back down the track
short and wide, tempts a flashy cut, but no contact
big stride and defended back down the pitch
forward and defended once again. What on earth can England muster from here?
outside off, another violent swish, yet another non-contact stroke
full and straight, and that, incredibly, is Baker's fifth maiden in an exceptional nine-over spell. Jolly well bowled
short, on the pads again, tucked to fine leg
full and straight, attacking the leg stump, and clipped to midwicket
flapped to point. Runs are a scarce commodity
forward, defended, plus ca change

massive appeal, looked to be swinging late, and potentially down the leg-side, but very full indeed. Bucknor ponders for an age, which is always a worry for the batsman, and sure enough, up goes the finger!
on the pads, flipped to square leg
full and straight, angling into the pads, defended back down the pitch
outside off, Mascarenhas winds up for a wipe, then decides not to, which is a shame
outside off, and beaten. Admittedly by about six inches, but an uncertain prod all the same
full and straight, and defended once again
shorter and wider, and a bit of carry through to the keeper. Still no stroke being threatened  from England's six-hitting specialist
determinedly defended with a hop onto the back foot
full once again, worked to midwicket
forward, defended to cover
a lot more width, and an ambitious mow. No contact once again, which is odd. Prior clobbered everything in that zone during the Tests
fuller, straighter, defended
right up to the bat yet again, Prior can do no more than work the ball to midwicket. Again
a bit of late inswing on a good length. Yet again midwicket tidies up
driven sweetly to mid-off
testing line and length but Mascarenhas leaves it alone
good length, driven out to the off side
leaves this one alone outside off
defended out to point
steps across to defend another maiden. Lost count of how many there have been - eight? Nine? More maidens than (insert joke here)
bit too full from Bravo and England get a whole single, flicking this to leg. The crowd jeer and cheer like the irony-seeking winners that they inevitably have to be
defended out to the off side
a bouncer is ducked. Quack
wide down the leg side
well back in his crease, nudges it to leg
an ugly but relievingly effective slap straight down the ground. For four.
turned to leg
another excellent line just outside off. Too tight for him to cut, though he did ponder it.
defended out to the off side
good line just outside off and he defends on the back foot
a thick outside edge - deliberately played. Outside off and he flayed it wide of the slip down to third man
turned to mid-on and they scamper a single - in comes the throw which hits the stumps, but he's safely home
full and straight, he comes forward to defend on the front foot
a short-arm pull to mid-on
very straight, nudged to leg
oh that is truly village. Short and wide and slapped straight to point. Thoughtless stroke
wide of the off stump and left alone
got him! A little off-cutter which squares up Broad, whose feet were firmly concreted, and it scooted through low to the keeper
ignored outside off
a solid defensive
a straight up-and-down delivery left alone
a touch of swing back into the right hander who fortunately gets bat on it
cautiously blocked by Batty
on middle-and-off, Batty is forward to defend
punched to mid-off
ooh, a thick inside edge into his boot - not far away from losing his off stump there
that's well played, pulling it down the ground. The rain's slowed the outfield a bit and he can't get four
defended on the front foot
slashed and flashed out to deep extra cover
good line, Gareth's back in line and defending
pushed to point
very straight, very full, driven back to DJ Sammy
crashed out to deep extra cover but he doesn't time it properly
Gareth forces it off the back foot for a single - and he's off the mark!
clipped to mid-on for another single. The runs are flowing
a rare mis-field by Gayle, who only occasionally looks bothered enough to move his body, at mid-off
crunched to point
on the back foot, Gareth defends
on the back foot, blocked
stylishly driven but brilliantly stopped by a short-extra-cover. West Indies' fielding has been electric all day
flicked around the corner
driven short of long-off
dropped out to the off side
back in his crease, almost treading on his stumps, whipped through midwicket
down the leg side
on the back foot, defended
skips back into his crease, blocking it with a straight bat
flicked down the fine-leg
down the leg side  -  Ramdin gets a hand on it, just
flicked off his pads
a fierce bouncer but it's way too short, quick and flies over batsman and keeper
nurdled for a single
angled out to the off side
driven to mid-off
cut to point
just outside off, guided out to the off side
that just held up a touch on Gareth but he played it well, with soft hands
a wide slower-ball
back in his crease, tries to whip it to leg but soon realises he can only defend it. Winner.
beaten by a beauty which lifted and left him. Sammy likes it but Ramdin doesn't. And nor does the umpire
right behind it this time, defending
defended on the front foot
nudges this to leg
good, straight ball worked to leg by G Batty
cracked to point
defended on the back foot and again he can't steal a run
a flashing but underpowered drive to cover
four! Pulled in front of square with excellent timing
flashed down to third man
patted to point
strokes this out to long-off
slower ball on the off stump which Batty defends solidly
defended on the back foot
dropped out to the off side
straight ball on the off stump which cuts back, and he defends solidly
square-cut out to deep extra cover
defended off the back foot out to the off side
good line, defended on the back foot
Gareth on the attack - a clumping and impressive drive but it finds long-off
left alone
too straight and he works it to leg
forced off the back foot
driven out to the off side
nicked to mid-on
flicked to leg
full and straight, he comes forward to defend
short, wide and cut for a single
beaten outside off! Well bowled
comes forward to defend
forward, driven to mid-off
well flighted on off stump and Mascarenhas again can't get hold of it
squeezed out for a zero
nice and straight and he defends
inside edged to leg
flicked to leg
outside off and defended
crashed out to deep extra cover
flicked through midwicket
swept to square leg
driven out to long-off
nudged to mid-on
pushed out to the off side
turned to leg
cut to cover
guided off the back foot
straighter delivery turned to leg
steps to leg and tries to smite it over midwicket, but, well, he can't
flicked to mid-on who swoops, throws down the stumps but he's home by half a yard
defended to cover
full toss on his legs, Mascarenhas steps outside the leg stump and flickes
terrific catch by Sammy, diving at extra cover as Batty's extravagant heave is mistimed
fuller yorker but misdirected down the leg side
full toss, bashed to Chanderpaul at mid-off who shies at the stumps. Good work by the utter, utter legend
a slower ball but Mascarenhas reads it and whips it to leg
wide of the off stump and ignored
flicked to mid-on
superb ball! Swings in late on his toes and he only just keeps it out
goes for a hook but top-edges it to the running square leg - another hook shot goes all wrong for England

inn2.comm: on the hip, tucked to square leg
even shorter! And Prior can only glove it over the bar. Oh dear
defended from a full length
better line and length, fizzes past the off stump as Gayle leaves well alone
driven on the up with an open face. Not a lot of control but plenty timing, and point does well to cut that off
flashed into the covers with a punch off the bat foot. 11 off the first over ... hum
an unexpected extra delivery, and Gayle smashes that up and over backward point! A vast six, and West Indies need an even 100 to win!
outside off, through to the keeper. That's a tidier line
outside off, and steered with an open face to third man
a bit of a nothing shot from Gayle, a limp deflection to third man, but effective enough
a big stride and a whip around the front pad
well wide of off stump, but no stroke attempted this time
extraordinary defensive shot - Gayle's back leg shoots out towards point as he is squared up by late movement. Still, no damage done, and that's a better over from England
patted into the covers
defended off the back foot, into the covers
another big stride, left alone outside off
poked out to point
tidy rhythm, but England need wickets to force pressure
a bit of a loose drive to conclude the over
defended into the covers. After that flying first over, West Indies barely need to break sweat
smashed, with a hop, through point. Too wide, and that gets the treatment
open face once again, and defended into the gully
cut, in the air, but dropping short of third man, who fields on the bounce and restricts Gayle to a single
flicked fine, no threat from England, no risk from West Indies. No need, frankly
that's just vast, on the hip and helped over square leg with shot that is more of a shrug than a statement. Total power and timing
on the hips and tucked to fine leg
tucked up, and defended back down into the crease
stunning strike, Gayle backs away but brings his bat exquisitely through the line. The ball rifles through the covers, and Broad rolls his eyes in bemusement
almost a repeat stroke, but slightly mistimed
bosh! That is enormous, over-pitched and launched towards the spaceship that is the 3Ws stand. Gayle has, incidentally, scored more sixes than Brian Lara now
backing away, and biffed past point - and Mascarenhas, who collapses in a tangle on the boundary's edge
full and heavy, and nearly a mix-up as Gayle is forced to hurry as Bopara swoops at square leg
pushed onto the back foot, but an easy single into the covers
defended with a clunk of willow into the covers
width, worked to third man with loose wrists
wide outside off stump, and no stroke for a change
a scampered single to finish the over. And "over" is the mot juste for this contest
fladaboom, to coin a phrase. Short, wide, and slapped through the covers
Hugh Mungus. Stand and deliver, a contemptuous swipe, clean over the sightscreen!
battered! That is incredible! Open-shouldered smash over the covers, that went flat and hard, and into the stands. Gayle has his half-century, from 27 balls!
a dot-ball. Boo
on the toes, up, up and away, into the beach at wide midwicket! This is hilarious, and the crowd are ecstatic
whoops, it's in the air, but there's enough bat on that to clear the ring at backward point
a dot ball! Outside off and left alone
calmly tucked to leg for a single
Gayle ignores this outside off
fullish and driven out to the off side
good full length by Flintoff and he's sat well back in his crease
firmly defended on the back foot. Good line and length, as ever
flap! Ugly, disdainful, powerful hitting! It's just remarkable. He stepped outside leg and flat-batted it over long-on

another one! This is an innings no one will forget. A shorter ball which he uppercuts, on the walk - on the jog, running away to leg-stump to clear his arms - and it flies into the third-man stand. Several rows back. What a stroke
dot ball. Smashed to mid-off
nudged to leg
slightly squared up out to the off side. Rubbish. Dot ball. Booooo
a walked single to long-on. No, I mean it - he didn't break out into a trot.
and Simmons just calmly leaves it alone to let Gayle have the strike in the next over
well back in his crease, he just pats it out to cover
short of a length and Simmons tucks it to leg
this rises up on Gayle who rides it to third man
a solid forward defensive
plays inside the line
shorter ball which he defends. Good pace from Flintoff.
four more. A leg-side full toss and Gayle just gets his bat on it, flicking it fine for four. Such clever batting. It's not all about the power, you know
boo - bowled him. Another full toss which Gayle tried to smash over midwicket but lost both his middle and off stumps
Sarwan clips to leg. Short midwicket makes a fine save
late swing into the right hander who can't time it
neatly turned to leg
an impressively compact defence on the back foot
tries to flick it to leg but there's no timing
firmly cut to point
magnificently driven! Wowee - the purest of cover-drives, wonderfully timed. Have some of that.
dropped out to the off side
shorter ball, ignored
outside off, Sarwan plays and misses
angled out to the off side
a straighter ball, turned to mid-on
neat stroke, pulling this with sweet timing around the corner
defended out to the off side
blocked off the back foot and it bobbles up, so he kicks it away to protect his stumps
guided out to extra cover
shorter ball from Flintoff which Simmons pulls around the corner. Not altogether comfortably; he rarely keeps his eye on the ball when he pulls
cuts back into the right hander who defends
oh, so close to losing his stumps there! A loose cutting flap outside the off stump, but all the luck's going West Indies' way and it flies down past Prior for four
full toss bashed out to deep extra cover for a single
good yorker but well dug out
bowled him! An inswinger which Sarwan played all around, losing his middle stump
flashed to cover
squeezed down the ground, they run two - no chance of a third there
guided out to mid-off and they scamper a single to record an emphatic thrashing of England
